question: Which of the following crude oil transportation pipeline is the longest in India?
explanation: The Hajira-Bijaipur-Jagdishpur crude oil transportation pipeline is the longest in India. It has a total length of 1750 kilometers. It was set up by the Gas Authority of India. It connects Kawas (Gujarat) to Jagadishpur (Uttar Pradesh) via Anta (Rajasthan), Bijaipur (Madhya Pradesh).
